snippet: Jets Coach Rex Ryan and General Manager John Idzik both have the right to stake out the pragmatic high ground, if only for the purpose of their professional reputations.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Football column examines grim outlook for New York Jets coach Rex Ryan and general manager John Idzik as team struggles through a humiliating season; holds that it is a good example of how a franchise can dissolve amid tug-of-war between leadership.
lead_paragraph: Jets Coach Rex Ryan and General Manager John Idzik both have the right to stake out the pragmatic high ground, if only for the purpose of their professional reputations.

headline.seo: Jets’ Rex Ryan and John Idzik in Tug of War to Salvage Some Dignity
headline.main: Flawed Partnership Leaves the Jets Floundering Again
headline.print_headline: Flawed Partnership Leaves the Jets Floundering Again
